image.altText: Australian economist Sean Turnell looking at the camera after an interview

items.synopsis: The economic adviser to ousted leader Aung San Suu Kyi was released by the military in a surprise move in 2022. A year on, he reflects on the dark days and having Brad Pitt play him if his new book makes the big screen.

title.children: Sean Turnell spent 650 days in Myanmar jail. He 'constantly dreams' he's still there a year after his release

image.altText: A young woman with long blonde hair stands by an Israeli flag

items.synopsis: Nicole's mother Galit was the only Australian to be killed by Hamas on October 7. Now she has returned to the kibbutz where she was murdered. WARNING: Some readers might find the details and images in this story distressing.

title.children: 'They've been in here, in my house, in my room': Daughter of Australian killed by Hamas tries to find closure

image.altText: A man and woman stand side-by-side wearing suits.

items.synopsis: Together they’ve saved thousands of lives with their breakthroughs on melanoma treatment. Now Professor Scolyer is "patient zero" in their latest research.

title.children: Cancer experts Richard Scolyer, who has an incurable brain tumour, and Georgina Long named joint NSW Australians of the Year

image.altText: Anthony Albanese shakes hands with Xi Jinping in front of the Australian and Chiense flags in Beijing.

items.synopsis: The itinerary of Anthony Albanese's latest foreign excursions involved some incredible diplomatic U-turns that neatly sum up the dilemma and danger we face in our region, writes business editor Ian Verrender.

title.children: Did we win the China trade war, or just move the battleground?

items.synopsis: Politicians and experts call for the end of violence on Australian streets and in the Middle East on Q+A but they can't agree on one panellist's assertion that terrorist group Hamas are not the only problem.

title.children: 'Abhorrent' protests should not be allowed to happen again: Q+A panellists condemn violence in Australia

image.altText: Close up of bearded man with determined expression, lake and trees in background

items.synopsis: Three Indigenous-owned corporations will receive government support, as they prepare to commercialise something they've been doing for thousands of years.

title.children: Cultural fishing practices given a leg up to help break into commercial fishing sector

image.altText: Man wearing a black shirt that says 'Burgertory' on the collar, with his arms folded.

items.synopsis: The Palestinian-Australian owner of a popular Melbourne burger chain says he has moved his wife and young child into a safe house after receiving a threat on his life over social media.

title.children: Palestinian-Australian burger chain owner moves family into safe house after death threat

image.altText: A man in a suit walking

items.synopsis: Brits were shocked when a former prime minister was parrachuted back into politics in the role of foreign minister on Monday, but many Australians know this story well, including how could end.

title.children: This political plot twist shocked Brits, but Australians know it well

image.altText: Buses in Adelaide Street in Brisbane city on January 11, 2021.

items.synopsis: What contribution has privatisation made to the creation of a better, fairer, more harmonious society? Britain's experience with the sale of its water and sewage network suggests not all industries come out on top, writes Linton Besser.

title.children: Britain's 'unbearable' sewerage problem is a warning against privatisation in Australia

image.altText: High density housing with predominantly dark roofs.

items.synopsis: Renters in every Australian capital city are in a worse position than they were before the pandemic, the latest Rental Affordability Index report shows

title.children: Renters in every capital city are in a worse position than before the pandemic, new report reveals

image.altText: A composite image of three men in suits.

items.synopsis: In New Zealand, the Labour Party ministers have just been re-sworn into caretaker government, despite losing the election. Here's why forming government is a little different in Aotearoa.

title.children: NZ has never had a coalition negotiation like this. Here's why it's taking some time

image.altText: Shane Cuthbert sits near a Nazi flag.

items.synopsis: Shane Cuthbert admitted it was "not a good look" and said he would remove the videos after questions from the ABC.

title.children: 'Not a good look': Cairns Council hopeful appears in videos with Nazi flag

image.altText: A white statue in the centre of the picture, surrounded by sandstone and stained glass windows behind

items.synopsis: An abuse survivor who will potentially receive one of Australia's largest-ever compensation payouts from the Catholic Church says he wants the verdict to give other survivors a "sense of hope".

title.children: Victim of paedophile priest shocked and vindicated by 'mind-blowing' payout from church

image.altText: Helicopter vision of the truck on its side at Horsley Park

items.synopsis: Police say the rental truck was carrying 3,000 litres of stolen diesel fuel when it crashed on a busy Sydney motorway, causing significant delays.

title.children: 'Lucky no one was killed': Two men flee after rolling truck filled with $6,300 of stolen fuel on Sydney motorway

image.altText: Legs of young people walking up stairs

items.synopsis: Young Australians are struggling economically and socially, with a national barometer survey highlighting a "darker" year-on-year trend as cost-of-living pressures bite.

title.children: Youth Barometer report shows that nine out of 10 young Aussies felt financial difficulties this year

image.altText: people walking outside a store

items.synopsis: Optus says "changes to routing information" after a "routine software upgrade" was behind last week's nationwide outage, affecting 10.2 million Australians and impacting 400,000 businesses.

title.children: Optus says changes after a 'routine software upgrade' to blame for nationwide service outage

image.altText: A tired young Caucasian man with brown hair squints his eyes to focus while holding glasses in hands in a meeting

items.synopsis: Pushing back against the wave of meeting invitations at work could improve your mood and your productivity. Here's how to go about it.

title.children: Is your workday filled with meetings? Here's why it's doing you more harm than good

image.altText: Close up of woman's face.

items.synopsis: A jury has heard a hit man was arranged to kill 61-year-old grandmother Stacey Klimovitch, but the defence contends the accused was not at the crime scene.

title.children: Jury told hit man was recruited by Newcastle father to kill his former de facto mother-in-law

image.altText: A middle-aged man and his early 20s son sit at the back of a small motorboat on a lake in front of mountains.

items.synopsis: Renowned polar explorer Dr Geoff Wilson and his 23-year-old son Kitalé are on a two-year mission to make the world fall in love with polar environments, and document their impacts from climate change.

title.children: 'We're graffitiing the Vatican': Inside the epic two-year project to document the degradation of our polar environments

image.altText: a man and a woman both wearing name tags standing outdoors and smiling at the camera

items.synopsis: The lawyer representing receivers tells the Federal Court, the alleged fraudster's second husband, Michael Koletti, has "completely backed down" from various claims over the estate.

title.children: 'Handful of items': Melissa Caddick's husband backs down from number of claims over estate, court told

image.altText: Dwayne Johnstone

items.synopsis: A jury finds a man dubbed Officer A not guilty of the murder of Dwayne Johnstone, who was shackled at the wrists and ankles when he was shot outside Lismore Base Hospital.

title.children: Correctional officer found not guilty of escaping inmate's murder

image.altText: Several police seen at a protest rally. There are flags and several uniformed officers.

items.synopsis: Premier Chris Minns says it would not be "unreasonable" for state governments to request financial assistance to cover the cost of managing recent rallies over the ongoing conflict.

title.children: NSW government hopes Commonwealth will help pay for million-dollar police presence at Israel-Gaza protests

image.altText: Two adults stand with a child in a wheelchair.

items.synopsis: Organising a trip to Ballarat was no easy task for this Melbourne family because of 12-year-old Anuli's complex needs. When the outing finally happened, it ended in a way that left them "traumatised".

title.children: 'Like a pack of hyenas': Melbourne family shocked after chain hurled at daughter in wheelchair during Ballarat visit

image.altText: A centrelink sign with on a building with a reflection

items.synopsis: The federal government agrees to all of the recommendations of the Robodebt royal commission, as it reveals investigations have commenced into 16 public servants connected to the scheme.

title.children: 'People were traumatised': 16 public servants investigated over doomed Robodebt scheme

image.altText: Concept art showing four warships fanning out in open waters.

items.synopsis: The Defence Department has conceded its process for selecting its $45 billion future frigates, closely overseen by Coalition ministers, was "poorly executed".

title.children: Defence admits 'poorly executed' process in $45 billion future frigate selection

image.altText: A close-up of someone wearing a camouflage US Marines uniform.

items.synopsis: Former US Marine bomb technician Evan James Williamson was planning to cook hamburgers and hotdogs when he attempted to light the barbecue and it exploded.

title.children: US government claims immunity after Marine burned by exploding barbecue at Darwin army base

image.altText: A local resident walks past a board encouraging to join a Russian army battalion in Melitopol, Ukraine.

items.synopsis: At least three Russian officers have been killed in the Moscow-controlled Ukrainian city of Melitopol in a blast Ukraine's intelligence says was an "act of revenge" by local resistance groups.

title.children: Blast kills three Russian officers in occupied town of Melitopol, Ukrainian intelligence claims

image.altText: A cassowary in the water as waves wash up on shore

items.synopsis: From a distance it resembled a mythic monster but as it came closer in the tropical Queensland waters a stunned onlooker realised the struggling creature was a large bird — and not a seabird.

title.children: Amazed beachgoer videos endangered cassowary emerging from ocean off Far North Queensland

image.altText: A brunette Pakistani woman, a blonde white woman and a dark brunette black woman wearing superhero outfits stand looking skyward

items.synopsis: Marvel Cinematic Universe's latest movie instalment, The Marvels, has had a disappointing opening weekend at the box office, recording $US47 million in sales in the US — the lowest amount the comic book franchise has recorded to date.

title.children: The Marvels has had the MCU's worst opening weekend at the box office. What went wrong?

items.synopsis: Kimba the lion was found in a rural area after a hunt by local authorities.

title.children: Escaped circus lion captured after roaming Italian streets for hours

image.altText: A green sea turtle floating in the ocean

items.synopsis: Rising temperatures are already skewing sea turtle clutches towards having more female than males, but new research suggests heavy metal pollution could be too.

title.children: Gender-bending heavy metals could be skewing the sex ratios of Australia's green sea turtles
